data.event: Its estimated 2014 population of 485,199 made it the sixth-largest city in California.
Sacramento is the cultural and economic core of the Sacramento metropolitan area, which includes seven counties with a 2010 population of 2,414,783.

event.title: 2002, the Civil Rights Project at Harvard University conducted

data.event: In 2002, the Civil Rights Project at Harvard University conducted for TIME magazine named Sacramento "America's Most Diverse City".
Sacramento grew quickly thanks to the protection of Sutter's Fort, which was established by Sutter in 1839.
